verses.verse: In that time period, Jesus traveled on the Sabbaths through the croplands. His students were hungry and began to be pulling off heads of grain and to be eating.
When the Separatists saw it, they said to Him, "Look, your students are doing what it is not permitted to be doing during the Sabbath."
Jesus said to them, "Didn't you read what David did when he and the people with him were hungry?
How he went into the house of God and ate the loaves of bread of the display, loaves that were something not permitted for him to eat, nor the people with him, just the priests alone?
Or did you not read in the Law that on the Sabbaths the priests on the temple grounds profane the Sabbath and they are innocent?
I tell you that someone greater than the temple grounds is here.
But if you had known what this is, 'I want forgiving kindness and not sacrifice,' you would not have found the innocent people guilty.
You see, the Master even of the Sabbath is the Son of the Person."
And after He walked somewhere else away from there, He went into their synagogue.
And look, there was a person who had the dried-up hand. And they asked Him, saying, "Tell us if it is permitted to be healing on the Sabbaths," so that they might level a complaint against Him.
Jesus said to them, "What person will be from among you who will have one sheep, and if this sheep should fall into a hole on the Sabbaths, will he not take hold of it and get it up?
So how much more substantial is a person than a sheep? In such a way, it is permitted to be doing nicely on the Sabbaths."
Then He says to the person, "Put out your hand." And he put it out, and it was reestablished healthy as the other hand.
The Separatists received counsel against Him (after they went out) in order that they might ruin Him.
When Jesus knew it, He took a back way from there, and big crowds followed Him. And He healed them all
and forbid them so that they would not make Him known
in order that what was stated through Isaiah, the preacher, (in Isaiah 42:1-4) might be accomplished that says,
"Look, My Servant Boy whom I chose, My Loved One, in whom My soul is pleased. I will put My Spirit on Him, and He will report judgment to the non-Jews.
He will not fight, neither will He make a yell, neither will anyone hear His voice in the plazas.
He will not break a stick that has been crushed, and He will not extinguish a wick that is smoldering until He puts out the judgment for victory.
And non-Jews will anticipate good in His name."
Then a blind and speech-impaired man who had a demon was brought to Him. And He healed him in such a way for the blind and speech-impaired man both to be speaking and to be seeing.
And all the crowds were being astounded and saying, "This isn't the son of David, is it?"
When the Separatists heard it, they said, "This Person does not throw out the demons except with Beelzebub, the head of the demons."
When Jesus realized their contemplations, He said to them, "Every empire divided against itself becomes uninhabited, and every city or house divided against itself will not be established.
And if the Opponent throws the Opponent out on himself, he is divided. So how will his empire stand?
And if I throw the demons out with Beelzebub, your sons, with whom do they throw them out? Because of this, they will be your judges.
But if I throw the demons out with God's Spirit, clearly the empire of God has already come on you.
Or how is anyone able to go into the house of the strong person and to ransack his containers if he will not first tie up the strong person and then ransack his house?
The person who is not with Me is against Me, and the person who does not gather with Me scatters.
Because of this, I tell you, every sin and hurtful comment will be forgiven to the people, but the hurtful comment against the Spirit will not be forgiven to the people.

And whoever says a word against the Son of the Person, it will be forgiven to him, but whoever says a word against the Spirit, the Sacred Spirit, it will not be forgiven to him, not in this span of time, nor in the span of time that is going to come.
Either make the tree nice and its fruit nice, or make the tree defective and its fruit defective. You see, the tree is known from the fruit.
Offspring of poisonous snakes, how are you who are evil able to be speaking good things? You see, from the excess of the heart, the mouth speaks.
The good person throws the good things out from the good treasure of the heart, and the evil person throws evil things out from the evil treasure.
I tell you that every idle statement that the people might speak, they will give back an answer concerning it in a day of judgment.
You see, from your words, you will be made right, and from your words, you will be found guilty."
At that time, some of the Old Testament transcribers and Separatists responded, saying, "Teacher, we want to see an indicator from You."
But when He answered, He said to them, "An evil and cheating generation looks for an indicator, and an indicator will not be given to it except the indicator of Jonah, the preacher.
You see, even as Jonah was in the belly of the huge fish three days and three nights, so will the Son of the Person be in the heart of the earth three days and three nights.
Ninevite men will stand up in the judgment with this generation and find it guilty because they changed their ways into the public speaking of Jonah and, look, a greater thing than Jonah is here.

A queen of the south will be gotten up in the judgment with this generation and will find it guilty because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the insight of Solomon and, look, a greater thing than Solomon is here.
When the spirit that is not clean comes out from the person, it passes through places without water looking for a break and does not find it.
At that time, it says, 'I will return back to my house from where I went out.' And when it comes, it finds a hangout that has been swept and decorated.

Then it travels and takes along with itself seven different spirits more evil than itself. And when it goes in, it resides there, and the last of that person becomes worse than the first. This is how it will also be for this generation, the evil generation."
As He was still speaking to the crowds, look, His mother and brothers had stood outside looking to speak to Him.
Someone said to Him, "Look, Your mother and your brothers have stood outside looking to speak to You."
But when Jesus answered, He said to the person who told Him, "Who is My mother? And who are My brothers?"
And when He put out His hand over His students, He said, "Look, My mother and My brothers.
You see, whoever does what My Father (the One in the heavens) wants, he is My brother, sister, and mother."
